ai.summary: Greenwich Meridian Trail (Cambridge Loop) is a 12.7 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom. The route follows ridge lines and woodland edges, delivering a mix of shaded paths and open viewpoints with a generally steady, undulating pace suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect ridge terrain with rolling climbs and descents, uneven grassy tracks, occasional stiles and gates, and sections that can be muddy after rain. Some stretches are exposed to wind and weather, so gear and footing are important.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy boots and dress in layers; bring waterproofs. Stay on marked paths, keep a note of your route, and let someone know your plan. Carry a map or GPS, sufficient water and snacks, a first aid kit, a charged phone, and an emergency whistle.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing with a waterproof jacket
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged mobile phone with charger or power bank
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) offer the best daylight, visibility, and trail conditions; winter hiking can be colder and more challenging with mud and wind.
